posts.name: Murilo Miranda Santos
posts.cooked:
Good morning everyone! My FRC team is having problems calling named commands within our autonomous system. The path is being followed, but there is no signal in the command call. I will leave the code below. All help is needed. Thank you all.

GitHub - muriloMiranda404/teste-new-swerve-subsystem Contribute to muriloMiranda404/teste-new-swerve-subsystem development by creating an account on GitHub.

Contribute to muriloMiranda404/teste-new-swerve-subsystem development by creating an account on GitHub.

posts.name: Murilo Miranda Santos
posts.cooked: wow! thanks for the help, i had no idea about that! thank you so much!

posts.name: Murilo Miranda Santos
posts.cooked: Unfortunately, it didn’t work to do what you told me. The robot still hasn’t called the command. Can you tell me if there is any other alternative?

I would put a breakpoint, debug statement or System.out.println statement directly before your call to setPathPlanner() and another one before your call to NamedCommands.registerCommand to double check your ordering.

Couple of things to do/check

A) Double and triple check that you have the right command name in the PathPlannerGUI. B) I would personally recommend moving the AutonomousCommands.configureAllCommands() to inside of your constructor of SwerveSubsystem.java , just before setupPathPlanner() .

However, this will have side effect of potentially triggering the constructor for SuperStructure , since it might be the first time that SuperStructure.getInstance() is called, and may result in unintended side-effects later down the line (hence, why singletons aren’t commonly used)

posts.name: Murilo Miranda Santos
posts.cooked: I was thinking about putting it inside robotInit. Could there be any errors?
There shouldnt be any errors, plus, it doesnt hurt to try.
